div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p: Kimberly Urie-Executive Director of Communications & Projects

Meals and work packets will be available for pickup on Friday in front of the High School from 9:00-1:00 (unfortunately, we will not be able to deliver to your homes this week). If you are not able to pick up your student's work during this time, please make arrangements for someone else to pick it up or it will be mailed the following day. Parents can turn in student work packets from the previous week during meal pickup or at a drop box located in the door beside the nurse's office. TEA guidance is now requiring teachers to take grades during this time. Assigned work is required and will need to be turned in weekly. This work will document our students' mastery of skills required to move to the next grade level. TEA is also requiring documentation of time spend for "at-home learning." Each packet of work contains a "Flexible Learning Log" that will need to be completed and turned in with work. If you did not receive your student's work from last week, please contact your student's teacher or one of the administrators. We will be sending home report cards using grades from the assignments done at home; therefore, it is very important that all students complete their work and return it to the teacher. Please be sure to communicate with your teachers if you need anything. Lastly, when you are dropping off and picking up assignments or meals, please make sure to follow social distancing guidelines. If you are sick or someone in your house is sick, please let an administrator know so that we can make alternate arrangements with you. Thank you!

Mustang Family, we are issuing a book challenge! Starting today, send in pictures of students reading. They can be reading hardback books, online books, magazines, comic books, graphic novels, etc. Send pictures to Kim Urie at kurie@burkevilleisd.org or tag her on Facebook. Below are resources for free online books. Let's keep our Mustangs reading!
Newton County Public Library (must have a library card)
7 Websites for Free Online Books for Kids

div.h1: School Closure And events postponed updates
div.p: Due to the continued COVID-19 concerns, our school district will remain closed and will follow the alternative learning program until further notice. We are also postponing the following April events:

If we are able to reschedule the events, we will notify you of the new dates and times. Also, the STUCO State Convention has been canceled. Please continue to monitor our website and Facebook for updates.Â

Starting tomorrow (Tuesday), we will be delivering 5 days worth of meals to children 18 and under. Bus routes will run their normal routes starting at 10am to deliver the food. Each child 18 and under who is present at the bus stop will receive meals. If a child is not present, they cannot receive meals. If your child does not ride a bus, you may pick up the meals at the High School bus pick up loop. The child must be present to receive the meals.Â
